result.execSummary:
The defendant Tory Koshaun Spencer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including DNA surcharge) during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.
Consecutive to:  consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: -  Defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so).

-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
-  Random screens.

supervisions.notes:
-  No possession of firearms or any weapons.
-  COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tory Koshaun Spencer in court with Attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  46  months, consecutive to any other sentence  -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  16 months  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  30 months.  

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program but IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Random screens
-  No illegal substances
-  Full-time employment
-  No possession of firearms or any weapons
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including DNA surcharge) during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so)
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.
Clerk:  jms
letters submitted to the Court by defense counsel as to sentencing.
JusticePoint Pretrial Report dated June 8, 2016 received and filed.

Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.  Court will take no action at this time.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Tory Koshaun Spencer in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Branch 30 for branch 28 for purposes of bail only. Court ordered GPS monitoring amended to allow for release for employment search, attorney contacts, and DMV visits as needed. Case remains calendared for sentencing 6/9/16 in branch 28.

COURT ENTRY MADE WITHOUT CASE FILE IN COURT:

Atty. R. Jones in court to request hearing as to bail modification for monitoring.
Court is not in session through April 1, 2016.  State's charging week is the week of April 4, 2016.

Branch 30 has agreed to hear the case.  Case adjourned to Branch 30 for bail hearing on March 31, 2016 at 8:30 a.m.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Court will modify conditions of bail:
As to electronic monitoring:
Court grants release for employment, travel to and from employment and appointments with legal counsel.

Defendant Tory Koshaun Spencer in court with Attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties; waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of  GUILTY  and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant was further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. 

PSI  not ordered.  Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28.

Bail conditions to remain as previously set.

Clerk:  jms

Attorney Gregory A. Renden in court, defendant Tory Koshaun Spencer not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense is waiting to receive more discovery.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 7.  Status conference scheduled for 07-14-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tory Koshaun Spencer in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Tory Koshaun Spencer in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Stipulation to the defendant having a previous Milwaukee County Conviction for Possession of THC is agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court.  Sworn for the state:Michael Lopez-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring and Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tory Koshaun Spencer in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Tory Koshaun Spencer in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
